text: Psalm 147
Praise to Yahweh for His Providence
Praise Yah.\f + \fr 147:1 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft ; here and v. \xt 20 \ft \f*
For \add it is\add* good to sing praises \add to\add* our God;
for \add it is\add* pleasant; praise is fitting.
Yahweh \add is\add* building Jerusalem;
he gathers \add the\add* scattered ones of Israel.
\add He is\add* the one who heals the brokenhearted,
and binds up their wounds.
\add He\add* counts \add the\add* number of the stars;
he gives names to all of them.
Great \add is\add* our Lord, and abundant in power;
his understanding is unlimited.
Yahweh helps the afflicted up;
\add he\add* brings \add the\add* wicked down to \add the\add* ground.
Sing to Yahweh with thanksgiving;
sing praises to our God with lyre,
who covers \add the\add* heavens with clouds,
who provides rain for the earth,
who causes grass to grow on the mountains.
\add He\add* gives to \add the\add* animal its food,
\add and\add* to \add the\add* young ravens that cry.
He does not delight in the strength of the horse;
he takes no pleasure in the legs of the man.
Yahweh takes pleasure in those who fear him,
the ones who hope\f + \fr 147:11 \ft That is, “wait expectantly” \f* for his loyal love.
Laud Yahweh, O Jerusalem;
praise your God, O Zion,
for he strengthens the bars of your gates.
He blesses your children within you;
\add he\add* makes your border peaceful;
he satisfies you with \add the\add* ⸤finest of wheat⸥.\f + \fr 147:14 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft fat of the wheat” \f*
\add He\add* sends out his command\f + \fr 147:15 \ft Or “utterance” \f* to \add the\add* earth;
his word runs swiftly.
\add He\add* gives snow like wool;
he scatters frost like ashes;
\add he\add* throws his hail like crumbs.
Who can stand before his cold?\f + \fr 147:17 \ft With slight alteration of the Hebrew, the line might read “before his cold water stands” \f*
He sends out his word and melts them;
he blows his breath, the water flows.
\add He\add* declares his word to Jacob,
his statutes and his ordinances to Israel.
He has not done so for any nation,
and they do not know \add his\add* ordinances.
Praise Yah.\f + \fr 147:20 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
